meanings.definition: To flirt or behave in a teasing manner to attract attention
meanings.sent1: She would coquet with the boys at school to get their notice.
meanings.sent2: He tends to coquet with everyone he meets, always flashing a charming smile.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to coquet with the dangling toy, swatting at it playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes coqueted with mischief as she teased him about his new haircut.
meanings.sent5: The wind coquetted with the leaves, swirling them in a playful dance.

meanings.definition: A person who flirts or behaves in a teasing manner
meanings.sent1: She was known as the school's biggest coquet, always charming the boys.
meanings.sent2: The coquet at the party had everyone laughing with her witty banter.
meanings.sent3: The little coquet in the playground had a line of friends waiting to play with her.
meanings.sent4: He was a true coquet, effortlessly winning hearts with his charismatic personality.
meanings.sent5: The coquet's smile was like sunshine, brightening up the room.

meanings.definition: A flirtatious or teasing action or behavior
meanings.sent1: Her coquet with words made him blush and smile at the same time.
meanings.sent2: The playful coquet in her tone hinted at a mischievous side.
meanings.sent3: The coquet of the puppy as it wagged its tail excitedly was irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The coquet of the breeze on a warm day felt like a gentle caress.
meanings.sent5: His coquet with danger often led to thrilling adventures.
